00129 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00130 //  Local classes
00131 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00132 
00133 class DOMPrintFormatTarget : public XMLFormatTarget
00134 {
00135     std::ostream *_out;
00136 public:
00137     DOMPrintFormatTarget(std::ostream *aOStream= &std::cout)  {
00138         _out = aOStream;
00139      };
00140     ~DOMPrintFormatTarget() {};
00141 
00142     // -----------------------------------------------------------------------
00143     //  Implementations of the format target interface
00144     // -----------------------------------------------------------------------
00145 
00146     void writeChars(const   XMLByte* const  toWrite,
00147                     const   unsigned int    count,
00148                             XMLFormatter * const formatter)
00149     {
00150         // Surprisingly, Solaris was the only platform on which
00151         // required the char* cast to print out the string correctly.
00152         // Without the cast, it was printing the pointer value in hex.
00153         // Quite annoying, considering every other platform printed
00154         // the string with the explicit cast to char* below.
00155         _out->write((char *) toWrite, (int) count);
00156     };
00157 
00158 private:
00159     // -----------------------------------------------------------------------
00160     //  Unimplemented methods.
00161     // -----------------------------------------------------------------------
00162     DOMPrintFormatTarget(const DOMPrintFormatTarget& other);
00163     void operator=(const DOMPrintFormatTarget& rhs);
00164 };
